div1.p: Carter delays his sailing date so that Laura Armistead Carter can remain in the hospital.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 5, 1911
div1.p:
I can delay my sailing
to Oct 2 - via the Siberia - so you
can remain at the Hospital as long
as you need. This should be a satisfac-
tion to Dr. Watson, as well as an advan-
tage to your-self & me, as I think she lit-
tle liked the idea of your leaving
hospital until partially well.
Nevertheless you need not stay a-
way any longer than is advisable
as we will be glad to see you in
Louisville “gruam bien's seme”
Also the longer rest period you have
in Louisville between the trips
the better. Indeed you can con-
tinue your rest & any treatment they
advise in Louisville. Just as you did
when you returned to our-Quarters
from Ward 17 at Ancon

I spent last evening with Kinyoun
& leave today - 4. P.M. - for Louisville
reaching that place at 10 A.M. tomor-
row.

Hasta la'vista Querida
e espera hasta luego o tam
bien
